content:
14. Which of these statements did God make to Joshua 
before the crossing of the Jordan? 
A. You shall lead my people with the staff of 
Moses in your hand 
B. The people of Israel will murmur against you 
as they did to Moses. 
C. This book of the law shall not depart out of 
our mouth 
D. You shall select for yourself men of valour 
who will cross the Jordan with you. 
 
15. Achan, who took of the devoted things during the fall 
of Jericho was from the tribe of 
A. Reuben B. Benjamin C. Judah D. Manasseh 
 
16. Who among the following people was connected with 
the war between Israel and King Jabin of Cannan? 
A. Egbon B. Jael C. Ehud D. Gideon 
 
17. ‘Alas, my daughter: you have brought me very low and 
you have become the cause of great trouble to me for I 
have opened my mouth to the Lord, and I cannot take 
back my vow. 
A. Hannah B. Peninah C. Samson D. Jephthah. 
 
18. Elkanah went to worship and to sacrifice to the LORD 
at Shiloh 
A. annually B.    monthly C. fortnightly 
D. every Sabbath 
 
19. Uriah did not wish to go down to his house because 
A. his wife was pregnant 
B. Joab would set him in the forefront of the battle 
C. the Ark was in the battle field 
D. David lay with his wife. 
 
20. Then the spirit of the Lord will come mightily upon 
you, and you shall prophesy with them ... 
A. Samuel B.  Saul C.  David D. Jonathan. 
 
21. The evil spirit that tormented Saul left him whenever he 
A. was asleep B. was at prayer C. drink wine 
D. heard David’s music 
 
22. Saul was made king publicly before the Lord and before 
all the people of Israel at 
A. Mizpah B. Gilgal C. Bethel D. Dan. 
 
23. When the Queen of Sheba heard Solomon’s fame 
concerning the name of the Lord, she came to test him 
with her 
A. questions B.  beauty C. army D. wealth. 
 
24. The greatest of David’s domestic problems that seemed 
to break his heart was the 
A. rape of Tamar by Amnon 
B. killing of Amnon by absalom 
C. conspiracy of Absalom against him 
D. murder of Absalom by Joab. 
 
25. Besides the gifts of wisdom, what other gift did the 
Lord promise to Solomon but with a condition? 
A. Riches B. Honour C. Long life D. Victory in 
Warfare 
 
26. When Joseph discovered that his betrothed Mary was 
with child, he decided to divorce her quietly because 
A. Mary was too tender and lovely. 
B. the angle warned Joseph not to be harsh on 
Mary. 
C. Joseph was disappointed with Mary. 
D. he was a just man. 
 
27. Though Herod wanted to put John the Baptist to death, 
he feared the people, because they held him to be a: 
A. priest B. preacher C. prophet D. for-runner of Christ. 
 
28. Which of these if NOT included in the instructions 
given to the disciples during their mission? 
A. Heal the sick B. Judge the people 
C. Cleanse lepers D. Raise the dead. 
 
29. Jesus asked his disciples not to disclose their vision of 
the transfiguration until the 
A. Crucifixion B. Resurrection 
C. Ascension  D. Pentecost.  
 
30. When Peter confessed Jesus as the Christ, Jesus replied 
that it had been revealed to Peter by 
A. my Father B. flesh and blood 
C. the spirit of the living God 
D. the son of man. 
 
31. Which of the following prophesied the signs of the 
end? 
A. Jeremiah B. Daniel C. Malachi D. Amos 
 
32. The parable of the labourers in the vineyard teaches 
above all God’s 
A. generosity B. strictness C. partiality D. justice. 
 
33. According to Jesus, every kingdom divided against itself 
is 
A. laid waste B. selfish C. satanic D. without a 
leader. 
 
34. Jesus taught that one should make friends quicklywith one’s 
A. enemy B. neighbour C. master D. accuser. 
 
35. The Pharisees and Scribes accused the disciples of 
Jesus of transgressing the tradition of the leaders 
because they 
A. did not regard synagogue rules 
B. did not pray before meals 
C. ate with unwashed hands 
D. disobeyed the elders. 
 
36. ‘Why this waste? For this ointment might have been 
sold for a large sum and given to the poor.’ The event 
which led to this saying took place in 
A. Capernaum B. Jerusalem C. Jericho D. Bethany. 
 
37. At His triumphal entry into Jerusalem, Christ had to sit 
on an ass because He 
A. had need of it B. was humble 
C. wanted to fulfill the scriptures 
D. was a king. 
 
38. But Jesus answered them, ‘You are wrong, because 
you know neither the scriptures nor the power of God. 
For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given 
in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.’ 
A. Sadducees B. Pharisees C. Gentiles D. Samaritans.
